Welcome to tokyo-python’s documentation!¶

tokyo-python is a set of Python interfaces to Mikio Hirabayashi‘s Tokyo libraries, it includes:

  • tokyo.cabinet, an interface to Tokyo Cabinet
  • tokyo.dbm, a dbm compatible interface to tokyo.cabinet
  • tokyo.tyrant, an interface to Tokyo Tyrant
  • comming soon, tokyo.dystopia, an interface to Tokyo Dystopia

Useful links:

  • Latest release
  • Documentation
  • Mailing list
  • Bug reports and feature requests

tokyo-python’s source code is currently hosted by Google code and kept in a Subversion repository.

  • Subversion instructions
  • Subversion browser

Content¶

  • tokyo.cabinet — Python Tokyo Cabinet interface.
    • Hash Database — HDB
    • On-memory Hash Database — MDB
    • B+ Tree Database — BDB
    • On-memory Tree Database — NDB
    • Fixed-length Database — FDB
    • Table Database — TDB
  • tokyo.dbm — dbm compatible interface to tokyo.cabinet.
  • tokyo.tyrant — Python Tokyo Tyrant interface.
    • Remote Database — RDB
    • Remote Table Database — RTDB
  • tokyo.dystopia — Python Tokyo Dystopia interface.
